description:
In the Daily Sceptic, a policeman defends the Met Police Federation Chair suspended after telling GB News that some officers are so terrified of being accused of 'discrimination' they're treating minority suspects with kid gloves.

The post Police Union Rep Suspended For Telling the Truth appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Police Union Rep Suspended For Telling the Truth

description:
Labour's poll lead over the Tories has fallen to just five points, while nearly half of those who voted Labour in July say they already feel let down by Keir Starmer's floundering Government.

The post Half of Labour Voters Say They Feel Let Down as Poll Lead Plummets to Five Points appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Half of Labour Voters Say They Feel Let Down as Poll Lead Plummets to Five Points

description:
UNRWA, whose staff were suspected of assisting in the October 7th Hamas terror attacks on Israel, has been shortlisted for a Nobel Peace Prize. The 'peace' committee really does hate Israel that much.

The post UNRWA Implicated in Hamas Terror Attacks Shortlisted for Nobel Peace Prize appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: UNRWA Implicated in Hamas Terror Attacks Shortlisted for Nobel Peace Prize

description:
If the thought of fracking gave you a panic attack – earthquakes! – then the risks associated with carbon capture should give you a heart attack. Miliband's latest wheeze is stark raving bonkers, says Chris Morrison.

The post Earthquakes, Leakage, Expense, Death by Asphyxiation – Is There No Beginning to the Advantages of Carbon Capture? appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Earthquakes, Leakage, Expense, Death by Asphyxiation – Is There No Beginning to the Advantages of Carbon Capture?

description:
Strict lockdowns, schools shut for months, haphazard business closures, rampant fraud – Tim Walz has a lot of questions to answer about his handling of Covid as Minnesota Governor, says Anita Jader.

The post Walz’s COVID-19 Legacy appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Walz’s COVID-19 Legacy

description:
No, Hurricane Milton is not 'evidence' that global warming is causing more frequent extreme weather, says Paul Homewood. Since records began in 1851, Florida has been hit by 41 hurricanes of Cat 3 strength or greater.

The post No, Climate Change Was Not to Blame for Hurricane Milton appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: No, Climate Change Was Not to Blame for Hurricane Milton
